Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s first entry into that particular camp called ‘Night Of The Living Dead’ spawned nine additional movies, as well as several popular theatrical sequels by other filmmakers. With popularity apparent, studios wanted in on this trend.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie, like going to the theater or whatever.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you in and reminds me of your favorite Disney princesses as Pocahontas and Mulan. And for this I think any little girl would enjoy it so don’t be shocked if they enjoy the Hello Kitty era found on screen and butterflies everywhere.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>
